title: Kimchi Stew
ingredients: - 4 cups chopped spicy cabbage kimchi, homemade or store-bought
- 1 yellow or white onion, thinly sliced
- 1 pound firm tofu, drained and cut into 1-inch cubes
- 3 serrano chilies, cut into ¼-inch-thick slices
- 1 tablespoon Mushroom Seasoning Powder, homemade or store-bought
- 1 teaspoon kosher salt, or more to taste
directions: 1. Place the scallions on a work surface and use the flat of a chef’s knife to firmly smash the whites. Cut into 1-inch pieces.
2. In a medium Dutch oven, layer the ingredients in the following order: kimchi and its juice, sliced onion, tofu, scallions and chilies, then inari.
3. In a medium mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, mushroom seasoning powder, garlic, ginger, gochugaru, sesame oil, salt, and water. Stir well to combine.
4. Pour the mixture evenly over the layered ingredients in the pot.
5. Set the pot over high heat and bring it to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and let simmer moderately without stirring until the onions are tender, about 10 minutes.
6. Taste and adjust salt if needed. Serve hot.
